intro: Saxifraga davurica subsp. grandipetala, commonly known as the large-petaled saxifrage, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its rosette of fleshy, dark green leaves and produces showy, pink to purple flowers in late summer. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Its flowers are typically borne on long, slender stems and are arranged in clusters. Saxifraga davurica subsp. grandipetala is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens.
